website_summaries.verdict: A good option if you want an alternative to traditional luggage; Samsonite's renowned quality in a duffel.
pros: A spacious, well-made polyester duffel that weighs only 13 lbs
Has wheels and a retractable handle for easy maneuvering
cons: Not as durable as others on our shortlist, but this might not concern you if you like the duffel bag style

customer_reviews.title: Two defects in first 6 uses; warranty is misleading!
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke after a month. One of the top handles broke off after ~1 year (maybe 5 or 6 uses). Samsonite has done a good job of marketing its warranty but the truth is, activating warranty protection is very cumbersome (you need to physically bring it into a service center) and therefore gives the consumer a false sense of security. Unless you're spending hundreds of dollars, don't be fooled that this warranty will give you peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: P. Burani

customer_reviews.title: At first I was satisfied with it in terms of size and function
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend against buying this bag. I've used this twice and after the first use wrote a favorable review. However, after a second use the main zipper is coming apart from the seam. This is a result of standing it on end. Given only light use it's a product defect that cannot be remedied unless you're willing to have it repaired over and over again. Samsonite offered a poor solution. It would entail me driving over an hour to a location to have it evaluated for repair with no guarantee that they would repair it.
customer_reviews.author: CGS

customer_reviews.title: Afraid to continue to use this luggage.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this one time. It kept falling over forward and the straps that hold the pouch is just about ripped off on the inside. I bought it because it's a Samsonite, but not impressed with this product. Not sure if it will hold up to another trip if the strap inside ripped. Definitely not suitable for air travel.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. I decided to ignore some of the negative reviews because overall the star ratings were decent, but that was a mistake. I picked my bag up from baggage claim with one of the smaller pockets busted wide open, zipper nowhere to be found. Great. Decided to keep traveling with it as it still more or less did the job, but after 2 more flights I notice the zipper for the main compartment is completely separating from the cloth. I took these photos in the airport where I had to buy another bag as I wasn't confident it would survive the flight. I'll be getting a refund and never buying Samsonite again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, the right size and easy to spot in the croud
customer_reviews.text: We were required to have bags that measured 54" or less LxWxH. for a tour. This fits those measurements and is easy to organize, rolls well, and in my case was the only one like it at any of the baggage drops, so easy to identify.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Pete

customer_reviews.title: The Lightest, Most Durable Suitcase I've Ever Owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this product back in 2014. Let's just say that it has survived multiple trips to and from South America, Europe, and the U.S since then. I've never even had to repair it once, and 6 years later, it still has a lot of life left in it! I love rolling duffels, not only because of the amount of space they provide, but because they are lighter than bulkier models and thus allow you to take more things with you! That being said, I even bought my hubby the same model last year. I hope Samsonite continues to make this particular model because it will be my go-to suitcase for as long as I live!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky L.

customer_reviews.title: Failure on third use!
customer_reviews.text: Seam along bottom zipper has begun to rip on third use. The bag has never been filled to capacity so it's difficult to say what the problem is beyond poor quality control - otherwise the bag's configuration is great. Very surprising from Samsonite considering the positive reviews and because its a "ripstop" bag! Unfortunately the tear has occurred in the middle of an extended business trip so there's no real way that I can get it repaired/replaced easily. I've called/emailed Samsonite to determine the best course of action but have not received a response. Never thought I'd see a Samsonite fail so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and very functional but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I used this in our five week trip to Europe. It was easy to take through the airports which is important. My husband's much cheaper roller duffel kept going off the rails. It fit well under the bed in the camper. It is a bit heavy unloaded which is why I only gave it four stars. It is quite sturdy as one would expect from Samsonite. I recommend it if you need to take a lot of stuff on your trip and are checking a bag. I do like all the compartments once I figured them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Rose

customer_reviews.title: I love my bag!
customer_reviews.text: I will not stop raving about this bag, I use so much equipment for work and this thing carries everything! I love that it stands instead of falling over- though you need to pack it heavy broad stuff at the bottom to enjoy this feature- and its stylish and professional! It’s so great I got the slightly smaller one for personal use and I love that one just as much! It accommodates over 10 sets of sheets, a massage bolster, mattress warmer, Blanket, folding stool, fan, numerous sets of twinkle lights, promotional materal, a toiletry it and several products.
customer_reviews.author: AmyRitter

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality and workmanship
customer_reviews.text: This piece of luggage has seen two airline flights and two road trips. It's now falling apart at the seams. Do not waste your money on this. It is cheaply made junk.
customer_reviews.author: Apotropaic Sphinx

customer_reviews.title: Fits so much!!!
customer_reviews.text: Being an avid traveler, I wanted to make sure I was investing in luggage that would support my longer trips and last me a long time. I've had this rolling duffel almost 5 years and about 20 trips later it still looks brand new. I recommend this bag to all my friends. A rolling duffel is definitely the way to go. It carries all my shoes, toiletries, and accessories possibly needed on the bottom and the top duffel can pack up to 3 weeks of clothes for me. It's great for keeping me compact and organized for my traveling days. Absolutely love it!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L.

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Compartment Zipper RIPPED
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this except the fact the the fabric near the corner of the bottom zipper ripped on the first use on an airplane, and made it barely usable. I did however use it, and it finished ripping to being unusable with another 4 uses. For whatever reason, the way baggage handlers move this around, it tears up the bottom compartment zipper, the same as another one I purchased from another source that was similar in design. That is exactly why I bought Samsonite, and it ripped anyway! VERY DISAPPOINTED. It was put in the trash after 2 months and 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Luke SkyWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Very large bag.
customer_reviews.text: This bag looks well made and holds a ton. We were surprised at the checked pattern on the fabric - it is more noticeable than the photos make it seem. It is not just a duffel bag that has access through the top opening, it has a second compartment on the bottom that opens more like a zippered suitcase. I’m not sure if this compartment is handy or inconvenient. It is nice to have a duffel this size with wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Expert Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke on third use
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these bags for extended trips. On the third trip, the zipper (teeth) on one of the bags pulled away from the cloth which normally holds those zipper teeth. Using dental floss, we were able to "repair" the damaged portion of the zipper, but then were unable to open the zipper beyond the repaired portion -- a major inconvenience. Does anyone know if these bags can be repaired? Can the zipper be replaced?
customer_reviews.author: Beltless in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag it has a lot of room enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag it has a lot of room enough extra packets for your small items the straps on the end and on the top help stabilize the bag so everything isn't shifting while the bag is being transported or when you are pulling is The wheels seem to be strong, time will tell. The handle is sturdy and extends just enough to pull the bag without putting to much weight on it I was able to pack 2 weeks worth of clothes without stuffing everything causing wrinkles
customer_reviews.author: Susan TreDenick

customer_reviews.title: Giant and light weight
customer_reviews.text: This duffel is light weight with straps to secure it better for airline travel. The size is GIANT. Big enough for my month-long trip to Africa next year. Great luggage for overseas travel and for those that can stay in one location (not lug it around to new lodging every day). It was too large for a simple 2-week road trip. EDIT: This bag is TOO large for airline travel. I did not understand what 62" linear meant and this bag is 5" too large for a checked airline bag, around the world: Length + Width + Depth which was 35+16+16. Rats.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Initial thought was this is a great piece of luggage with tons of room, several well-thought compartments and nice maneuverability. However, after one trip as checked baggage, a couple zippers are broken and the retractable handle is stuck open. This duffel will probably be fine if you just use it for road trips and handle with care, but not suitable for air travel. Grateful Amazon took it back for refund
customer_reviews.author: larryw

customer_reviews.title: Bag does not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag (and a Samsonite roll-aboard) based on the brand name. I unfortunately must report that neither have lived up to their billing. Like others, the lower compartment zipper ripped from the material - and it really wasn't under stress. Not over packed. I think poor design sewing the zipper to the material on either side of it. I am going to contact Samsonite to see if they will repair it and will update this once I find out. For now, I can't recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E SMITH JR

customer_reviews.title: Ruined after only two trips.  Very well designed except the main zipper tore out in two trips.
customer_reviews.text: The main zipper wore out / tore out from normal use after two trips. Bad design flaw! I saw that on some other reviews, took the gamble, and I lost. Unfortunately the return window was one month and most of us don't travel two times in one month. Otherwise, I really liked the size and especially the way the compartments were designed. But it is now unusable and cost me over $50 per trip. Ouch. I haul a heavy teaching set of rocks in a different suitcase, and have taken them on many international trips, and that bag has held up well for many years. But this Samsonite bag self-destructed carrying just ordinary clothes after only two trips.
customer_reviews.author: grateful reader

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't hold up!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a trip to Peru. The first bag was missing a zipper foot after the first leg of the trip. Irritating, but fixable. We took the undamaged one to HA last week and the clasp on one of the side straps broke. I just can't count on these bags to be in good shape for a trip. My last off brand, rolling duffel bags lasted for 10 years, these didn't even make it to 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for trade show materials
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to travel with my trade show displays and other trade show related items. It holds two felt backed poster displays, posters, extension cord, power strip, and a few other misc. items and comes in at just under 50lbs for weight purposes on airlines. This is my 2nd one as I gave my first set of trade show setups away to a colleague who uses and travels with them overseas without issues. They can get a little front heavy fairly easily and have a tendency to want to tip over, but for something that holds as much as this bag does, weighing as little as it does, it performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Fits a lot and deals with weight well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to move everything I owned from the US to Canada, and they did the job well. I was able to pack a mixture of items -- small and large, heavy and light -- in these bags. Be warned, though, that they are able to store so much that you won't realize how heavy they are until you lift/weigh it (and especially when you are charged for an overweight bag at the airport).
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull around in the airport
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for our cruise. My wife found packing them to be more difficult than the suitcases, particularly the top portion as it will tend to collapse if you don't have enough stuff it in. That was somewhat troublesome as partway through the cruise we had used a bunch of the clothing, leaving the top half very floppy and everything in it wanted to shift and crumple. They do have a lot of space and we didn't have any problems with the construction. Lots of zippers and pockets and straps. Easy to pull around in the airport. Fully packed, it stands up ok (under-packed, you will need to lean it against a wall or it will fall over).
customer_reviews.author: E. Ellingson

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Very Cheap construction, It fell started falling apart at the seems after like 9 uses. And during none of these uses was the bag full. You actually can't put much into it before you approach the weight limits for airline travel, so most the time you travel the bag is like 1/4-1/3 full to keep it under 50lbs. Heck I think empty the bag is like 15lbs or something crazy. It is also just too big for most car trunks, I would not suggest this to anyone. Oh and there is not really anything of a warranty (they put so many hoops to jump through and make it so inconvenient that it is easier to just buy a better product)
customer_reviews.author: Kelson Baird

customer_reviews.title: Bag Ripped on FIRST trip
customer_reviews.text: Lining inside of top pocket ripped during my FIRST flight. I had the bag 2 days and it didn't even last one flight. This is clearly a manufacturer defect as it is on the inside of the bag, so the airline had nothing to do with it. The lining in the bag is very flimsy. You would think it would be more heavy duty, given the size of the bag and the weight of clothes it will be holding. However, I only had my small toiletry bag in that compartment, so it doesn't make any sense why that small item would make a bag seam just rip right out.
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: We purchased 3 large and 2 medium sized of these ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 large and 2 medium sized of these bags. Everyone one of them has broken zippers, rips and broken buckles. We had the same exact bag in the Burton Snowboard brand for over 15 years and they finally kicked the bucked. These started breaking from the first trip. They have been on a total of maybe 6 trips (max) in two years by plane and probably 12 trips by car. These are cheap for a reason. The zippers break, the fabric rips, the mesh inside rips. For how many times we used them they were not worth it. I should have bought Burton bags again. They are double the money but would have lasted 15 times longer......
customer_reviews.author: Janey Smith

customer_reviews.title: The warranty was pretty rubbish since I'd have had to drive quite far ...
customer_reviews.text: The zipper in the main compartment broke after only 2 trips. The warranty was pretty rubbish since I'd have had to drive quite far from home (I live in a capitol city but the repair centre is almost an hour out). It was going to be so time consuming and expensive since I don't have a car that I got it patched up by a local shop and paid the bill. Not happy Samonsite! Aside from that major detail, the bag is well distributed and has massive amounts of space! But it's quite heavy so for flying it's not very practical - I hit my weight limit before I'd even got it half full.
customer_reviews.author: James Fred

customer_reviews.title: Very good duffel when the wheels work
customer_reviews.text: Mixed review on this one. Bought one in 2012 which is still fully functional and holding up well in 2017. Bought a second in 2015 which busted one wheel a year later (rubber tread slipped off wheel rim) while still relatively new and on its 3rd-4th trip. To be fair, that could be attributed to workmanship and quality as well as well as packed weight and airport ground handling. A very tough duffel overall with uppers that can stand most abuse. The wheels however are touch-and-go; could last 5 years or more or 1 or less depending on construction and usage.
customer_reviews.author: NRN

customer_reviews.title: Substandard Product
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of moderate use it started coming apart. After 2 years it was not usable as the lining ripped, zippers broke and buckles came off. Very surprising that Samsonite would sell a product that is substandard and frankly of such poor quality. What is even worse is that they wouldn't honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: BajaSands

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this bag
customer_reviews.text: There is plenty of space, yet the bag doesn't take up much space. Unfortunately, this was the second of these that I bought and it had the exact same issue as the first one. The zipper comes separated from the bag very quickly. My first bag lasted about 6 months before this happened. I lost the warranty information but I thought it might be just this one bag was a lemon, so I bought another just like it. The second bag didn't even make it two flights before the zipper started separating from the bag.
customer_reviews.author: L Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: Hate is a strong word so I wont use it here. The product just not well made. Besides it being bulky and cumbersome, on my first trip the zipper stitching came apart. I was able to work the zipper and get it closed well enough to check my bag to get home... I then used Amazon's great return policy and sent it back for a refund. There are too many choices of good luggage out there.
customer_reviews.author: NVESTOR

customer_reviews.title: This duffel does not inspire confidence in Samsonite.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the name. The fabric seems quite sturdy. It's a bit stiff. The design is intelligent. Although the handle is short, it's comfortable to pull behind. However, on first use the wheels bowed out. The duffel wobbled and flipped repeatedly while being pulled. One of the zippers came unhinged, and I don't see how to put it back. Other zippers appear to have mismatched areas. The bag was full but not overpacked. By the time of first use, it was too late to return the item. One month return policy Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Ross, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size - Holds a Lot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this duffel for a 3-1/2-week trip to Europe in the summer of 2015, It is a winner! Although not a large duffel, there was plenty of room for everything I needed (I am female), yet it wasn't too unwieldy in airports, trains and subways. Packing was easy, and the extra small pockets came in very handy. The bag rolled very smoothly and was further easy to maneuver with the various handles. This bag weathered a flight to London, Eurostar to Paris, flight to Dublin and flight back to the US (plus a couple rides on the London Tube and Paris Metro) with not a scratch, rip or broken zipper. Would buy again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Duly Diligent

customer_reviews.title: Great LARGE rolling bag for my trade show and business travel needs.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to carry my table top display equipment and pull up signs with me. This works perfectly thanks to the 2 divided sections of the bag - I put the heavy goods in the bottom, zip that up, then the lighter soft items on top. Well constructed. I've checked it at 50+ lbs with Southwest Airlines several times and it came thru with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this duffel as a replacement for the FUL hybrid duffel that did not survive its first flight due to zipper failure. The material is very durable. It has multiple attached straps on the outside to tighten the bag and keep things from shifting. (This is a must as items shift more in a duffel than in a regular suitcase.) No extra luggage strap is needed. This duffel held up through multiple flights and rough handling. You can easily go over the 50# weight limit as this duffel has a very large capacity. I was very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: connie v.

customer_reviews.title: Three year warranty - who knew!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three of these. Two 35" and one 30". They are holding up well after several transatlantic trips. On my last trip to US clip came off zipper at one end. Took it to Kwik Shoe and Luggage repair to be told that these cases are under three year warranty so repair done with no charge. Good to know as no mention of warranty in descriptor.
customer_reviews.author: E. Redford

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for money
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the money. Been to Alaska 3 time with it from east coast. Drug it on ferries, small planes and commercial airlines. Shows little signs of wear and has protected contents. All zippers and wheels still intact too. Plus it has plenty of room for rods, gear bags and clothes, and split level comes in handy for keeping cloths separated from gear. would give it 5 stars if rip stop was a little heavier material.
customer_reviews.author: BisonR1@aol.com

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Wheel broke on first trip.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Great name, but cheap product. Right from the get-go, I had my doubts. The zippers were really cheap and don't really give you any reassurance that your stuff is still going to be contained when you land. I intentionally used an extra luggage strap as a result. Long story short... On the very first trip, a wheel broke. Awesome. Nothing like try to drag a broken suitcase that all loaded up through JFK with only one working wheel. Easy return process through Amazon which was greatly appreciated, but this bag is worth skipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED! Lasted 2 months only!
customer_reviews.text: We realize baggage handlers dont care but this is why we searched high and low for something durable for frequent travel. This was purchased April 6th. Sadly, it has already seen its last trip. Not recommended at all for frequent travel. The bottom compartment ziooer has been torn off. And as you can see the bottom busted with tears and rips and busted zipper. Very diasappointed in baggage handlers but also in durability of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S

customer_reviews.title: Only Checked Bag you'll need
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect. I used it for 2 weeks trip to Europe, AND and over-packing for a 4 day trip for a family wedding. Even though it's big enough for 2 weeks worth of clothes, less clothes are easy to pack because of the nature of the bag. I was able to use the straps to squeeze it down because it was less full. During the 2 week trip, I was also able to add to the bag with items I purchased, plus items my wife couldn't fit in her bag. Just a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Stoebel

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality, great design
customer_reviews.text: The design, fabric and wheels are awesome. The manufacturing quality is bad. Side pocket Zippers ripped after first travel. Main one started to frail so had to carefully pack and use top zippers for loading. Didn't survive last overseas travel. See pics. Samsonite needs another vendor to build this great bag for them.
customer_reviews.author: Maja Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and practical
customer_reviews.text: This is our 4th bag. They are very practical. Fits 45 lbs of stuff. The different compartments help keep order. They are sturdy but nothing is immune to the airlines maltreatment. So, if you are lucky, it will last Many trips. Mine have held very well.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn freundlich

customer_reviews.title: Zippers Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: Have had the bag for a year and it is falling apart. Four of the zippers have come off or separated from ket compartments. This is unacceptable. Was used on a 3-week summer tour in 2018 and then placed in storage until June of 2019. Packed for another 3-week trip and proceeded to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Brookes

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after a few years
customer_reviews.text: This thing has held up quite well over the past 6 years I suppose between 3 international moves and numerous trips within the USA - but is starting to break down with rips in fabric making unusable. Lasted a while I guess!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This one in its smaller size ends up being perfect for my air travels
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag to complement the behemoth brother I bought last year. This one in its smaller size ends up being perfect for my air travels. It has survived baggage handlers in Orlando, Detroit, Amsterdam, Venice, Trieste, Barcelona and Carnival Cruise line. And it still looks and works like new. Once again Samsonite has made a great piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain and tough
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. Plenty of room for two weeks worth of travel and several nice little separate compartments. It's a pull behind bag (not a four wheel roller) but that's fine with me. It's showing some slight wear after six intercontinental flights, but that's to be expected of any bag, especially at this price point. Very few people have these so they're quite easy to pick out of the conveyor line, although another fellow and I accidentally switched bags in Hong Kong, so check your name tag anyway.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Duffel Bag, Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Best duffel bag I've EVER bought! It is incredibly roomy and has so many great, useful compartments. I was very impressed at how much I could fit in it, unbelievable really; it's just wonderful! It is very well constructed too -- the wheels are robust and maneuver efficiently, the handle is quite sturdy as well (though I wish it were a tad longer) and the zippers are metal with strong seams. The mesh inside is also excellent quality., as is the overall material used, plus the color combination is lovely, quite vibrant yet elegant All in all this is the Rolls Royce of duffel bags and I'm now forever spoiled by it. Very highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: NessaMia

customer_reviews.title: Skateboard
customer_reviews.text: It's big, must be checked in when traveling. The bottom is perfect for the length of a skateboard (the only real reason we purchased this). It is a great travel bag for those who don't like suitcases.
customer_reviews.author: I shop

customer_reviews.title: tugging handle fell apart
customer_reviews.text: the bag works well like a samsonite product should. color is a little goofy but..... after using the bag a few times for several extended trips to Europe. one shaft of the extending handle broke loose and sunk into the bag never to be retrieved. i am sure it could be repaired but at what price? probably what i paid for the bag. it is now trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dell D

customer_reviews.title: Packs EVERYTHING and More . .
customer_reviews.text: This rolling duffel bag is a great way to pack and travel for longer periods of time . . I used this bag to travel 3 weeks across Europe and it performed great. Easy to get into and the bottom portion packs all the flat items, shoes, souvenirs, etc. Rolls easy and with the two handles its easy to load and unload from vehicles. Great Bag!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Adair

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trio!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of 3 bags that we purchased to take our son to college. My son, who is very picky liked the style--and that's saying a lot. We used the smaller one for a 5-day trip that required a quilt, sheets, clothing, pillow, and shoes, etc and everything fit with room to spare. We are using the larger bag for use at college. This bag has been absolutely wonderful. We vacuum sealed his clothing and now don't need all 3 bags. Holds a ton; have accessible pockets. Will provide a picture as soon as we get everything packed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Oversized and quite durable.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cruising and I wanted something that I could fit a sizable amount of my wardrobe in for cruises of 7-14 days. This one did the job. Could fit everything I owned in it and add the kitchen sink if I had to. There are quite a number of pockets and the wheels and handle are quite durable. I am thinking of getting its younger twin which would allow for air travel. This bag is to large to take as checked luggage unless you are willing to pay for excess baggage. Straps are still intact and zippers work. Well made Samsonite.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great wheeled duffel for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 'Plenty of room for seven days worth of clothes plus the bottom compartment is great for shoes. No problems with size at the airport. Unique coloring make it easy to spot on the conveyor too! It held up well under baggage handler abuse as well. My only complaint is that only one zipper is designed to be locked. But that is a minor concern given the fact that a soft sided bag is not really secure even if locked. The wheels are nicely recessed which helps protect from damage. I have had spinner wheels ripped off of a bag in the past, so I like how low-profile these are. I am pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckB

customer_reviews.title: The bag was fine when I used it about 4 months later
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag exactly 3 times. The lower zipper broke during the first trip, outbound, overseas flight. I taped it for the return flight. I had it repaired when I returned home. The bag was fine when I used it about 4 months later. The same zipper broke the third time around, also during the outbound flight. My bag arrived with my items falling out of the bag--not too much fun. I returned home with nothing in the lower portion of the bag----big disappointment and way too expensive for a bag that doesn't get through a round trip. I thought Samsonite luggage was reliable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: William White

customer_reviews.title: Good So Far
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a couple of times, but this is good so far. Seems very well made and should last quite a few years. There are tons of pockets and you can really fit a lot in this bag, enough for a long vacation. It's very big, so you may want to consider the size below this one depending on how you are going to use it. Super easy to spot on the luggage carousel too!
customer_reviews.author: Rehomore

customer_reviews.title: Poor at Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these bags for a single trip and both broke before the trip was over. The handle on the larger one broke quickly and the zipper on the smaller one separated and both were replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Tourne Koller

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: It’s lightweight and has a lot of smaller compartments in addition to the 2 major compartments. Very easy to maneuver around the airport, too. The drop bottom makes it convenient to pack for 2 people. An excellent piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable, Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Used on one trip, to and from a destination, and the zippers on the top pocket broke. Unfortunately its not returnable and there's no alternative through Amazon if its outside of your return window. I'm going to try Samsonite to see if there's anything they can do to help me, otherwise I'll have someone put a new zipper in. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: leanne

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace the exact same bag that we ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the exact same bag that we had for years. Our previous one lasted at least 3 or 4 years and we do a LOT of airline traveling. Sadly, this one broke on the first trip. Zipper and side completely ripped from the fabric and the bag wasn’t even close to being full. Travel pro brand here I come. Samsonite wont ‘t fix it since the day it wasn’t defective.....
customer_reviews.author: Everyonesaunt

customer_reviews.title: Not for frequent travel
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of monthly travel, the seams on the bottom compartment have now broken. The gauge of the zippers seems to be smaller than other Samsonite luggage we've previously purchased. Would recommend for infrequent travelers, but definitely not up to par for frequent fliers. Disappointed and now looking for other brands to try.
customer_reviews.author: Craig and Rose Roberts

customer_reviews.title: easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, holds a ton of stuff, easy to pack, and a good price. 4 rollers would be nice, but still, so far wheels have been good over some many miles. Easy to spot on the luggage carrier at the airport. Not a big fan of blatant advertising name brands, and this one has Samsonite emblazoned across the whole bag, in bright red, so you can't really miss it, but you will know its' your bag!
customer_reviews.author: coleen

customer_reviews.title: He was looking for the best deal on large luggage
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this luggage for a trip overseas. He was looking for the best deal on large luggage, and found this from a Youtube review. It is very roomy! He packed sheets, a sleeping bag, a pillow, a couple books, clothing for 8 days, a jacket, and toys for children. It weighed in at 48 pounds at the airport. The bag held up beautifully through checked luggage on two flights. The rollers and handle saved his back. And its a nice looking bag that is easily spotted on the carousel. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Tara K.

customer_reviews.title: I do like that it is big and has many zippers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this luggage, because of the Samsonite name in September 2015. I do like that it is big and has many zippers, but after using it twice one of the straps in the bottom portion of the bag connected to the red mini zipper ripped from the inseam, this bag was not overfilled at all. Today I used it for the third time and the bottom portion zipper blew out!! My things were outside the luggage at baggage claim!!! The handle is also very short, it only comes up 4-5 inches. I would NOT recommend this luggage, it won't last. I'm VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use on a trip this summer. She is now on the trip and the handle is stuck and she can not push it down. This creates a huge issue and she is telling me she needs me to buy her a new one because it won’t fit anywhere with the handle up. For a company like samsonite I would expect more. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G.

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling bag. It opens so shows are separated from clothes. I wish it weighed a bit less but it really is my favorite bag. It holds up fabulously. They have been to Europe 3 times and go cross country every other month. I have bought 5 of them to share with my kids.
customer_reviews.author: nmg308

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag so much I how have 2! My original 30” that I took on a cruise to Alaska & a 26” for smaller outings. Love the extra locking straps to the bottom 1/2 of the duffel so you know your belongings are securely in place & will remain there in case of zipper breakage. Lots of pockets, holds a lot!!! DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED THIS BAG!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: hngio

customer_reviews.title: Nice features, but zippers fail
customer_reviews.text: Between my wife and I we have owned 6, yes 6 of these. I like the design, fabric durability, good wheels, but all 6 have failed at the zipper seams. Every single one. The zippers rip away from the base material. One failed in two trips. I believe this is a quality design flaw. Other duffels I've owned have never failed at the zippers seams. This one is good for light, non-airline travel, but not durable enough for routine flight travel. Too bad, I liked the features. I'm moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Shipp

customer_reviews.title: Returned without waiting for them to rip
customer_reviews.text: We had our old Samsonite wheeled duffels for years until the zippers gave out. Luckily I knew to travel with duct tape just in case. I ordered these hoping for the same quality but was disappointed with the material of the bag and the lining. The zippers are really cheap as well. I returned these bags immediately. I then visited a local Samsonite outlet and found duffels with the strong material that I was accustomed to but the zippers were plastic. All one would have to do is twist my luggage lock to break it open. Why Samsonite would use cheap plastic zippers is beyond me. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Broke in the first 2 months. I flew 3 times before two zippers were ripped, and I wasn't even packing it at capacity. Very sad it didn't work out because Samsonite used to be great. Probably won't do any more of their brand because you have to buy their most expensive to get anything halfway decent.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Enormous / Zippers not durable
customer_reviews.text: This is an enormous, lightweight piece of luggage. We purchased 7 of them in the two larger sizes for our family. They do tend to tip forward, which is a nuisance. We had to throw one of them away because the zipper broke. It is a good piece of luggage for the price, but the zipper is not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: N. Melamed

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at Such Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Main zip broke on first trip, and the bag was not over loaded. While the straps held the two half’s together, this was not what we expected from Samsonite! Given such poor quality, I strongly suggest anyone avoids this bag, as there are much cheaper options which can’t be any worse. Will not buy Samsonite again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Chawton

customer_reviews.title: Very big bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is huge. I could put me in it and still have room for my clothes. This bag stands up well without falling over. There are plenty of pockets and it is very easy to move about. It's also definitely easy to make very heavy because of it's size. I arrived overseas to the bag being opened at the large zipper on the bottom, but this may have been because of the TSA and not the zipper. I'll update the post if I figure out otherwise. However, the bag held up threw three flights, a boat, and a hotel transfer. So far, for the money, it's a good bag.
customer_reviews.author: redchillismoke

customer_reviews.title: Great for those ski trips!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a friend for a ski trip. So glad we purchased this product and was very happy to have it on our trip. Highly recommend this luggage especially for bulky items when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag with many compartments. I originally went to get the North Face Rolling Thunder but then got this instead and love it actually better than our NF one. Samson also means strong man which I don't know made me want to purchase it even more. Recommend and easy to travel with does not always stand on it's own but really for the size, it is awesome. Get a travel scale and make sure does not go over as packs so well and fits so much, we have several times but just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: Jedidiah

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations !!!
customer_reviews.text: I work in the Oilfield so I am constantly traveling from north to south in Mexico or Overseas, That means that I need to carry clothes for 1 month, personal items, books plus my coveralls, hardhat, safety boots etc. No problem to make them fit in even there is room left for extra towel, blankets, pillows, Souvenirs, extra clothes for going out and so on. Very Happy to have one of this ! p.s Be careful to don't exceed the weight limit at the check in in the Airport xD
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bag Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: I like the ripstop it is heavy duty, the storage is excellent it hold too much and I had to take stuff out and put in carryon for flight so weigh your bag before you go to airport. Now it did not get 5 stars the first flight the zipper came off the end, it was not sewed properly I will fix myself so I do not have the problem again. The wheels are excellent and the handle also solid. It could easily hold 75 lbs but I had a 50lb weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Rock N Roll

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was able to fit so much into this bag, and because it is so lightweight, I did not go over my weight limit for the airline. I love all the different compartments, but there were so many that sometimes I had problems remembering which zipper led to which treasure. Wheeling it around was very easy, and the flexibility of the sides made it easier to fit in small places. And yes, once it is empty it does fit right under a bed.
customer_reviews.author: Melody 51

customer_reviews.title: Works great and has survived three Domestic flights with no damage
customer_reviews.text: Works great and has survived three Domestic flights with no damage. Lot bigger than I thought, have to be careful on the 50lbs limit since it can hold so much, last flight I weighed in at 49.5 lbs. This weighs a bit by itself. About 13lbs empty. Plan to buy the next size down for shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Here for a good time not a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these, I travel weekly for work, and each has failed almost exactly 6 months after I purchased it. Financially, buying one of these every 6 months is still cheaper than a normal suitcase that I found lasted a year in this travel lifestyle. Zippers are the first thing to go in my experience. The first bag the large zipper between the bottom and top section separated from the bag leaving a exposed hole. The second bag the zipper for the sandals/shoe area broke and couldn't close. Overall it's a solid bag, but it has its weaknesses.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Zipper didn't Last 30 Days
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag, but it broke on my second trip. Bought on 1/29/2020. Tried to file a warranty claim with Samsonite and was denied, they said it was out of warranty. Don't know how to get help and get this repaired. Guess I need to ask Amazon for help.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: You could EASILY over-pack this bag well over the 50 lb
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 'gear bag' to pack heavy and bulky items for working out of town: this bag is very well made and extremely roomy. You could EASILY over-pack this bag well over the 50 lb. airline weight limit! The zippers seem heavy duty as well as the material and there is ample compartments if your looking to separate items. I just received this product and from 'first impressions' I expect it will last as long as you don't let too many 'gorillas' handle it or throw it around!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Fujimoto

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to move my daughter into college. It’s fantastic. Sturdy. Holds more than you think. Wheels are smooth. The bag itself is lightweight. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Marino

customer_reviews.title: Samsonite! I was so close!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! It has lots of zipper pockets that are well put together. It rolls very well and stands up on its own. Much better than previous bags that were similar.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag with some limitations.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding for a car bag, which is what I bought it for, may not work as well for plane travel. Bag has a lot of belts and zippers that have the potential to snag on things.
customer_reviews.author: $afe Money Man

customer_reviews.title: Zippers Broke Quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for < 1 year & have taken < 10 trips w/ it. I have to buy another bag already. I will NOT be buying this bag again. My last rolling duffel, same size, was $50 from Costco. It held up great for years. 3 of its zippers have broken, including a zipper on the main pouch. The bag has a 1" buckle strap on the top side. It serves no purpose and gets in the way of opening the bottom compartment. The 2 fabric handles are in the wrong direction - it should be 1 handle, turned 90 degrees, like most bags. It's a Samsonite & I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NDG

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this bag one of the pocket zippers broke and spilled out some of my stuff on the baggage carousel. I thought maybe it just got snagged on something and it was an unlikely accident...I wish. Over the next few uses more zippers broke until finally the main compartment zipper broke and the bag became completely unusable. This bag is extremely cheaply made and will not even stand up to the lightest possible use. Samsonite should be embarrassed to still be selling this piece of crap. Spend a little more money and you can get something way more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan E

customer_reviews.title: Room For Plenty
customer_reviews.text: Used this once so far on a trip to The Bahamas. Plenty of room for all your needs. The bag will stand upright when packed which is nice. One drawback is when using the end pockets with something heavy like a pair of shoes, they have a tendency of collapsing towards the middle when the main pocket is opened. Also, when using the drop bottom storage area make sure it's full. This will help support the items in the main storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: She's one tough world traveler
customer_reviews.text: This baby is exactly what I was looking for, she really can handle a load. Very durable and I have taken her everywhere from Japan and in between. The wheels are a great size allows me to pull her up some stairs, the extended arm does seem it might break if you try to pull on it being the bag up the stairs but so far it's still hanging tough. Plenty of pockets, zippers are durable would definitely recommend. I always notice my bag at baggage claim, nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sony Vilbrun

customer_reviews.title: Nice and big, but ultimately did not last
customer_reviews.text: This duffel is HUGE and easy to overpack for airline travel, but if you are big and strong, you could live out of it for a month or more. I enjoyed this duffel for approximately 14 months, 20+/- trips, and then the zipper on the bottom compartment near the wheels came apart, as in the teeth detached from the tape holding them in place. If I can find the "lifetime warranty" paperwork, I will file for it, but that was two projects and 3 states ago, so I'm not optimistic. I expected more from a Samsonite product.
customer_reviews.author: Architectrix

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Bulkiness and Hard to Stpre
customer_reviews.text: I Regret this purchase. The bag is heavier than it needs to be. Seems of nice quality but is bulky to the point I can’t even store it under my bed. Boyfriend has had 2 Chances to use it since his birthday and has chosen another bag both times.
customer_reviews.author: Jenine Biskup

customer_reviews.title: I like this duffel a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this duffel a lot, but it is a little akward in the way it opens(in the middle). This may just be a matter of getting used to it, but it seemed like everytime I opened it, what I wanted was in the other side. But overall it is very nice and holds a ton of stuff! Be careful not to go over that magic 50 lb!
customer_reviews.author: KatieDid

customer_reviews.title: Holds an amazing amount
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful piece of luggage. Well designed, many pockets. Easy to roll through airport. Holds more than you can.imagine. so glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cook breakfast for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite travel bag I've ever purchased. Durable, easy to spot on the carousel, and well designed. It's a small footprint but still a checked-bag size and would probably fit a miniature donkey inside if you needed it to. In other words it fits everything you need it to and more. I usually take it for 2-3 week trips to Alaska. Already bought the 22" version for carry-on purposes because I'm now a Samsonite fan forever.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: It is nice light weight bag with plenty of compartments
customer_reviews.text: It is nice light weight bag with plenty of compartments. The problem is that the zipper on the lower compartment is already failing after less than a year of use. I use it possibly four times a month.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful luggage
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and nice design with cute distinctive color. Got it on sale so it was a plus. This will definitely be useful for more future trips abroad.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I've always thought Samsonite meant quality... I ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always thought Samsonite meant quality... I purchased this luggage to make a five week trip, and on the second day of travel the teeth on the zipper separated from the cloth part of the zipper. The luggage was not over-stuffed (as the airlines only allow 50# you cannot carry very much). I will not purchase Samsonite again. I had to secure the luggage with zip-ties for the remainder of my trip.
customer_reviews.author: SAAK

customer_reviews.title: Large and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really like this bag. It's design allows it to hold a lot of stuff. I filled the bag completely and was able to stay within the 50 lb airline limit which is good. The fabric seems sturdy. I just wish the zippers were more robust. I was afraid that the zippers would break. But, I just completed the first leg of a trip on a major airline with a connecting flight and the bag made it through just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Product Review

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but...
customer_reviews.text: When I started using the bag, I loved it. Loved the pockets, the easy access front compartments, it even fits my yoga mat perfectly. But I am constantly on a tour bus, airplane or train going all over the world and this bag held up well for only six months. The zipper stitching on the lower portion came undone and during my trip I always had to guide the zippers back together so they can seal my bag closed. I am hoping to send it in for warranty, but I would have rather avoided it all together.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality for price....zipper on the small pocket at the end of the bag was broken right out the box but still zipped somewhat, not completely closed though. After only one trip it was completely broken and the pocket flipped inside out while in transit. I am very disappointed in this product considering I paid a premium price for the Samsonite brand. The only reason I am giving two stars instead of one star is that I like the design of the bag with multiple options to open.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne R.

customer_reviews.title: I love that there are compartments that can help me keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a a large duffle bag. This seemed durable. I loved that there are compartments that can help me keep gear organized. However, it didn't make it out of the airport before it fell apart. I expected more with Samsonite
customer_reviews.author: Debora Dorko

product_meta.title: Samsonite Ripstop Wheeled Rolling Duffel Bag, Blue, 35-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:35-Inch| Color:BlueGreat casual duffel for easy travel
feature_bullets: Locking zippers on main compartment. Rivets on bail handles for support and strength.
Interior divider - Made of flexible mesh fabric is designed to help create a seperate compartment inside your suitcase for added organization and security
Ripstop - Extra strength fibers are interwoven into fabric at specific intervals to provide exceptional tear strength in a light weight material
Inline skate wheels are constructed of polyurethane with ball bearings to minimize frictional resistance

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,079 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
